Description: The evolution of metastatic disease in patients with solid tumors can be captured by sequential blood analyses for circulating tumor cells (CTCs) and tumor-derived cell-free DNA (ctDNA). Such “liquid biopsy” analyses have the potential to change clinical practice by exploiting blood as complement to invasive tissue biopsies as a source of information how to treat individual cancer patients. Here, we will address the current state of the art and open questions in this fast-evolving field of liquid biopsy research with emphasis on clinical applications for personalized medicine.
Location: New Orleans Theater B, Convention Center

Title: Liquid Biopsy: From Discovery to Clinical Application
